SENT.plain: Extracranial carotid artery aneurysms is a very odd pathology which first sign usually is a neck mass
At present the arteriosclerosis is considered its main source and surgery is promoted as its regular treatment, but each case must be managed according the distinct peculiarities showed
This paper reports the clinic and radiological features of a woman diagnosed of bilateral carotid aneurysm with the addition of a thrombosis check afterwards of the left jugular vein
Because of the rarity of this case think justified the record
A bibliographical perusal of this singular entity accompanies the article
